intro: Epipactis bithynica, commonly known as the Bithynian helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant produces a single, erect spike of flowers, with lip-shaped petals that are often yellow or greenish in color. Epipactis bithynica is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks. It is known for its ability to thrive in partial shade and its preference for well-drained, calcareous soils.
